Subject: Clarification on getCanonicalString vs getURI on CrawlURI

Hi,
I would like to know the differences between getCanonicalString() vs ge=
tURI() methods in CrawlURI class.

What I am trying to do is, If there is l=
ink say https://abc.com present in CrawlURI, then I would like to replace i=
t with *://abc.com. There was legacy code written and that uses getURI() to=
 do this. Since, I could not find any setter method(setURI()) on CrawlURI, =
I planned to use getCanonicalString/setCanonicalString() instead of getURI(=
).

I would like to understand the impact of this change.

some differences=
 I found are,
1. some letter in getURI()'s result has UpperCase and those a=
re lower case in getCanonoicalString()
2. I could see some url result writt=
en by getURI() starts with http://www. and the same was staring with http:/=
/ using getCanonicalString().

some questions are,
1. Is there an alternati=
ve to accomplish this task?
2. Is there a way to setURI()?

Any suggestions=
 would be appreciated.

Thanks in Advance,
Thamizh
